Description: Fragment from the shoulder and neck of an Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel. Upper part glazed inside; outside, glazed above figured panel, edged at bottom with band in dilute glaze; below, band of dots and stylised ivy leaves, overlapped by curved object with incision and traces of added white, possibly a helmet crest.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1220)
